title: Firefox login loop
content:
Hi, there are several threads with my problem, but none of the solutions worked. Here the problem:

I use VPN for a certain database. The site requires authentication, even within vpn, which is not bad. Authentication happens through a small popup window. Each and every time I enter my credentials, Firefox springs back to this stage until my account is locked. Edge or Chrome do not have this problem. I use MS Edge under Linux, only for this one website. I already tried disabling my extension, cleaning my cookies, starting login on a freshly installed Firefox, nothing helped.

I would appreciate any hint not related to the steps already mentioned.

Thanks and regards Tibor Anca
creator: anca.tibor

title: Mutiple extensions order of execution & compatibility
content:
I currently run extensions Privacy Badger, ClearURL's, and Facebook Container recommended by Firefox as well as UBlock Origin, and CanvasBlocker (currently disabled because it might have stopped some sites from loading).

Does anybody have experience running all these extensions at once? Is there an order in which multiple extensions are executed? Will they play nicely together or create conflicts among themselves? Are there recommended troubleshooting processes in case they don't?. I imagine that there must be some overlap of functionality somewhere in here, so any experience or advice is appreciated. I found no info when searching for the order of execution.

Extension purposes. UBlockOrigin and Privacy Badger used to block tracking, seem to block different trackers and usually do well together. CanvasBlocker is to try and limit browser fingerprinting, was running with the above two extensions until I had an issue connection to a website, don't remember which one, disabling CB fixed it and I haven't tried to figure out why yet. ClearURL's because almost all search engines are going to attach tracking to url's.

Thank you in advance for any help. Regards

title: Unexpected reaction on right mouse button release - how to disable
content:
A few versions ago (donʼt know exact one) a new effect appeared: when pressing right mouse button on an element to get its menu (standard Firefox menu, not overridden by the page), if mouse cursor position is over a popup menu item, this item is immediately selected on mouse _release_ button.

In most cases the context menu popups right to the mouse position and this causes no effect. But if there is no place to right (the selected element is near right screen margin), a menu item appears under the cursor and, as stated above, is selected. It is unpredictable what item will be selected.

This is rather controllable (although annoying) with real mouse but uncontrollable with touchpad, as on most laptops.

Please suggest how to disable reaction on the mouse button release.

title: All of my One Tab sites disappeared when Firefox asked for new profile
content:
Using my laptop: I have Firefox set to automatically update. I believe there was an update several weeks ago. Today I had been working in Photoshop, exited it, clicked on the Firefox tab I had open and clicked for a new tab. A window opened asking me for a new profile for Firefox. It said I needed this because there is a newer version of FF. It was weird. I entered the info and then was asked if I wanted to import bookmarks, etc. from Chrome (I rarely use Chrome) so I clicked to import. My big beef with this is all of my saved url's in One Tab are missing. I use One Tab all of the time so I lost a lot of information.

1) Can someone tell me what causes FF to do this because I had the latest version open?

2) Can someone tell me how to get my One Tab information back?

Thank you in advance for help, Becky
creator: becky.pottsbaker
